title: Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 does not work on some fields in the help search
OB: When using Ctrl+F1 in the help search, the expected behavior is for a help pop-up screen to appear, displaying information about the HelpSearch. However, this is not happening for certain fields in the search interface.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch Eclipse with a Double Byte Character Set (DBCS) locale.
2. Select 'Search' from the menu bar, then choose 'Help'.
3. In the Help Search window, click on the first text field and press Ctrl+F1.

Expected Result:
A help pop-up screen should appear, providing information about the HelpSearch.

Actual Result:
Nothing happens when Ctrl+F1 is pressed on certain fields in the Help Search interface.

Comments:
1. This issue occurs in all DBCS languages.
2. The problem is observed only for the first text field in the Help Search window. When navigating through the other fields using the Tab key, Ctrl+F1 works correctly.
3. Please refer to the attached screenshot for a visual representation of the problematic field (highlighted in red), as well as the fields where Ctrl+F1 functions properly (highlighted in green).
